a.title: Twin Day - Read Across America RG

img.title: #2290e38e282045eab5d8e5992522e7e9
img.alt: Twin Day - Read Across America RG

div.p: Robert Gordon celebrates Read Across America Week! Mrs. Genao is pictured with students in kindergarten, 1st grade, and 5th grade who dressed alike for twin day!
EJF-Aldene Principal Sloan Scully with students and officers from the RPPD
Mrs. Warren's kindergarten class had a visit from a farmer, rooster and hen. He left us with eggs to hatch. We can't wait for the new arrivals!
Second grade students in Mrs. Antonelli's class work on SEL lessons with Caroline Gleason, the guidance counselor.
Mrs. Wenzel, one of our Sherman School parents organized Grati-Tubes, a school-wide activity to teach students the importance of gratitude!
January 27th was the kick off of Kindness Week. Sherman Student Council Members hold up a sign to welcome the younger students.
EJF-Aldene practices kindness throughout January in honor of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Pictured above is Rocco Penn being the "I" in KIND.
Sherman School Student Council Members greeting our younger students to kick off Kindness Week!

br.a: Información sobre el virus de corona

span.br:
Effective Tuesday, March 17th, 2020 and until further notice, the schools, fields and sports/recreation areas will be closed.

div.span: Roselle Park’s mission is to provide a quality education through shared responsibility in a safe supportive environment for all students to meet the challenges of a global society. We are “Committed to Excellence”, and we work hard to make the site a primary source for timely information for all users, and a main gateway for improved communication between parents, teachers, students and other members of our community.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 10px; text-align: left; line-height: 22px; font-family: Georgia, serif; font-size: 15px;
margin: 0px 0px 10px; text-align: left; line-height: 22px; font-family: Georgia, serif; font-size: 15px;
margin: 0px 0px 10px; text-align: left; line-height: 22px; font-family: Georgia, serif; font-size: 15px;
p.span: Moral character is not developed automatically. Efforts should be made to assist young people to develop the values necessary to make good moral decisions and conduct themselves in an appropriate manner.

p.style: margin: 0px 0px 10px; text-align: left; line-height: 22px; font-family: Georgia, serif; font-size: 15px;
p.span: In the Roselle Park School District we have made a commitment to:

ul.style: margin: 10px 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 30px; text-align: center; color: rgb(61, 61, 53); line-height: 22px; font-family: arial; font-size: 14px;

li.span: Value every person as diverse, important and unique.
Accept responsibility for our choices and actions.
Be a positive influence on our planet and learn from the world around us.
Appreciate that children are best supported when family, culture, community and society are kept in mind.
Continually strive to put children first.
Recognize that the teaching and modeling of core ethical values as well as the promotion of good character development, is the responsibility of every adult.

span.div: All visitors shall be required to report to the principal’s office upon entering the school building. No staff member shall transact business with or permit the continuing presence in any district school of a visitor who has not been duly registered with the principal’s office. No one will be allowed entry without prior appointment. No one will be allowed entry without prior appointment.

ul.li: All visitors to the schools will require a prior appointment (at least 15 minutes notice) stating the reason for the appointment.

If a student has a scheduled appointment, such as a doctor/dentist appointment, the student’s parent/guardian must provide the student’s teacher with written correspondence, such as an email or note, advising the teacher of the time of the student’s pick up from school.
In case of the early release of a student from school, visitors must present personal photo identification in order for the school to release the student to the visitor.
